intro: Diplectria conica, commonly known as the conical diplectria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
